From Franton.Lin at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 00:25:58 2014
From: Franton.Lin at students.olin.edu (Franton Lin)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 00:25:58 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Play in the Pit for Xanadu!
Message-ID: <CAKtQVUEurwk5NceOTXhq414GkJ6cFDyVucH6-zx2H=0=CraWHg@mail.gmail.com>

Can you play piano, guitar, or drums?

If so, you should consider playing in the pit for this semester?s FWOP
production XANADU.  It?s a musical set in the eighties about this guy
opening a roller disco while helped by a Greek muse.

Please email me back ASAP with what instrument you play and how much time
you can put in. Putting together a live pit would be a decent time
commitment because we have to learn the music in the next five weeks. It
would also be a ridiculous amount of fun.

I look forward to hearing from you!

Hi all,

3v3 Basketball game is happening again Wednesday night. We shall keep our momentum from last week (won by 44 that?s right :D) and secure the w. Game is at 9pm so we?re meeting up at 8pm in EH1 and head over together. We?re wearing black.

From: Chu-Hao Fan
Sent: Tuesday, September 23, 2014 5:27 PM
To: basketball at lists.olin.edu; carpediem; Sawyer Vaughan; Kevin Suzuki; Griffin Tschurwald; Dong Kang; Filippos Lymperopoulos; Brendan Caporaletti; Zhecan Wang; Charles Mouton; Deniz Celik; David Abrahams; Adit Dhanushkodi; ByumHo Jang
Subject: &#127936;&#127936;&#127936;&#127936;3v3 basketball intramural @ Babson&#127936;&#127936;&#127936;&#127936;

Hi everybody,

THE 3v3 basketball intramural is happening! Woohoo! Game is gonna be on Wednesday nights starting this week for four consecutive weeks. Anyone is welcome to come. This week's game is this Wednesday @ 8pm against team 4. Please wear something dark.
In addition, refer to this link for schedules and rules. http://www.babsonathletics.com/information/intramurals/3v3basketball
*you may or may not be on the team roster but if you show up I guarantee that you can play :) so plz come if you want to ball some. We will meet at EH 1 @ 07:20 and head over together for some pregame warmups.

See you tomorrow,
&#127936;Jack&#127936;

From Luke.Morris at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 09:12:17 2014
From: Luke.Morris at students.olin.edu (Luke Morris)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 09:12:17 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Water Polo Tonight!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA703@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Everyone,

The captain of the Wellesley water polo team gave us permission to go practice with them! They're a team for beginners and encourage new players to join every year so no experience is necessary. I'll be heading over at around 3:30  today to play.

Practice is 4-6pm.

Let me know if you're interested!

-Luke

From Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 10:58:55 2014
From: Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu (Dakota Nelson)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 10:58:55 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Foundry Office Hours
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA5B9@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA5B9@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA790@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Now with [cid:image002.jpg at 01CFDD66.B1DE43D0] % more iCal!

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Dakota Nelson
Sent: Tuesday, September 30, 2014 9:04 PM
To: Foundry at lists.olin.edu; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Foundry Office Hours

Hey everyone!

A few Foundry members will be holding office hours in the Foundry space, CC300, at 5:00 on Friday until the Foundry meeting at 6:00.

Come by if you...

*         Want resume tips!

*         Want to know more about the startup fair!

*         Want to know what the startup scene in Boston is like!

*         Want a job! With a startup! (Or not a startup.)

*         Want to talk about entrepreneurship and starting a company!

*         Are curious about the Foundry!

*         Are awesome!

It'll be great. Also, if you have a suggestion for a less boring name than "office hours," come on by and tell us.

See you all at 5:00 on Friday!


Dakota on behalf of the Foundry

Dakota Nelson | Class of 2017
Tel: 605-877-4076 | URL: www.dakotanelson.com<http://www.dakotanelson.com/>
[cid:image003.png at 01CFDD66.B1DE43D0]

</span></b><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;color:#00B0F0'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt'>We will be showing on an outdoor<o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt'> movie screen on the </span></b><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;color:#00B050'>Great Lawn! From Sara.Hendren at olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 13:55:25 2014
From: Sara.Hendren at olin.edu (Sara Hendren)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 13:55:25 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] donuts + prosthetic hands, tomorrow at 11 am
Message-ID: <D051B84D.691%sara.hendren@olin.edu>

In case others are interested, the Adaptive + Assistive co-curricular will have guest Mike Benning from Hanger, Inc tomorrow, showing us four different prosthetic hand models he?s used over his lifetime, including his current smart-phone-compatible i-limb. He?ll also talk about the future of prosthetic technologies in general. And there will be donuts from Union Square, Somerville!

11 am tomorrow, Oct 2, in AC 313 (or down the hall in the corner lounge possibly). Let me know if you?d like to come, even if you?re not a regular attendee!

More on Mike: http://boston.cbslocal.com/2013/05/16/scituate-man-gets-bionic-hand/
More on Hanger: http://www.hanger.com/Pages/default.aspx

Sara Hendren

From las at olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 17:57:39 2014
From: las at olin.edu (Lynn Andrea Stein)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 17:57:39 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Mark Somerville/Dave Goldberg online book party tonight
References: <ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec261287ed92c9.20140929200908@mail16.atl161.mcsv.net>
Message-ID: <2C3C0F8D-D710-4B03-B600-6AF060617CDF@olin.edu>

"A Whole New Engineer" is Mark and Dave's story of the transformation of engineering education at Olin, UIUC, and more broadly through the kinds of things we celebrate at Olin.  Join Dave's online book party tonight -- google hangout and twitter -- and help spread the vision.

Begin forwarded message:

From: "David E. Goldberg" <deg at bigbeacon.org<mailto:deg at bigbeacon.org>>
Subject: SPECIAL INVITATION!
Date: September 29, 2014 at 4:09:19 PM EDT
To: Lynn Andrea Stein <las at olin.edu<mailto:las at olin.edu>>
Reply-To: "David E. Goldberg" <deg at bigbeacon.org<mailto:deg at bigbeacon.org>>



SPECIAL INVITATION





[https://gallery.mailchimp.com/ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec26/images/81f16eeb-4dcf-481e-b0c0-071cf70cb5ed.jpg]<http://threejoy.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec26&id=76287bcc91&e=1287ed92c9>
You?re Invited to an
Online Book Launch Party

(Be Among the First to RSVP and
Receive A Free Kindle Copy of the Book)



What:
Google On Air Hangout to Celebrate Launch of a New Book?A Whole New Engineer: The Coming Revolution in Engineering Education<http://threejoy.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec26&id=98f6a06562&e=1287ed92c9>
When:
Wednesday, October 1, 2014, 7:30-8:00 pm Eastern

Who:
All are Welcome, No Exceptions!

With Whom:      Hosted by CEO of Thought Leadership Leverage<http://threejoy.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec26&id=98f4e90c8a&e=1287ed92c9>, Peter Winickinterviewing the writing team of A Whole New Engineer<http://threejoy.us4.list-manage2.com/track/click?u=ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec26&id=5bcc9e74e4&e=1287ed92c9>, Dave Goldberg (CEO of BigBeacon.org<http://threejoy.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec26&id=394b8f1852&e=1287ed92c9>) & Catherine Whitney (noted author and writer).


How (Part 1): The party starts with a Google On Air Hangout at the link:http://bit.ly/1paU558<http://threejoy.us4.list-manage1.com/track/click?u=ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec26&id=49fb59f8d3&e=1287ed92c9> at 7:30-8:00 pm (Eastern).  Listen in as the writing team talks about the making of the book and the surprises, twists, and turns of bringing the book to fruition. Live tweeting of the video conversation will take place on Twitter at hashtag #BigBeacon.  Send your comments to other partygoers or send questions to the Google Hangout using twitter with the hashtag #BigBeacon.  Use http://tchat.io<http://threejoy.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec26&id=fc17bf2383&e=1287ed92c9>to automate the #BigBeacon hashtag and listen to all the tweeters.

How (Part 2):  Join the Big Beacon twitter chat from 8:00-9:00 pm Eastern (Hashtag #BigBeacon) as Meagan Pollock (@MeaganPollock) and Erica Lee Garcia (@EngineerYrLife) pose thought-provoking questions for an open discussion arising from The Making of A Whole New Engineer.  What do you think?  Share your opinion with others.

RSVP & Special Offer:

The first 100 people who RSVP their attendance at the online party before 5pmEastern on Wednesday, October 1, will receive a complimentary Kindle copy ofA Whole New Engineer: The Coming Revolution in Engineering Education.

Send an email to deg at wholenewengineer.org<mailto:deg at wholenewengineer.org> with the subject line: ?We Want A Whole New Engineer? and in the body of the e-mail write one sentence about why the book is of interest to you.



RSVP to deg at wholenewengineer.org<mailto:deg at wholenewengineer.org?subject=We%20Want%20A%20Whole%20New%20Engineer&body=The%20book%20is%20of%20interest%20to%20me%20because...>

Questions: Write to Dave Goldberg, deg at wholenewengineer.org<mailto:deg at wholenewengineer.org> with any questions you have about this invitation.


Hope to see you Wednesday, October 1, 2014, at 7:30 pm ET to celebrate the coming of A Whole New Engineer.

Use<span class="Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href="http://threejoy.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ee79516fbb85e34e8047bec26&amp;id=fc17bf2383&amp;e=1287ed92c9" style="word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(0, 0, 205); font-weight: bold; text-decoration: underline;">http://tchat.io</a>to automate the #BigBeacon hashtag and listen to all the tweeters.<br><br><span style="color: rgb(255, 0, 0);"><strong><span style="font-size: 18px;">How (Part 2):</span>&nbsp;<span class="Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></strong></span>Join the Big Beacon twitter chat from 8:00-9:00 pm Eastern (Hashtag #BigBeacon) as Meagan Pollock (@MeaganPollock) and Erica Lee Garcia (@EngineerYrLife) pose thought-provoking questions for an open discussion arising from The Making of A Whole New Engineer.&nbsp; What do you think? &nbsp;Share your opinion with others.</td></tr></tbody></table></td></tr></tbody></table><table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" class="mcnBoxedTextBlock" style="border-collapse: collapse;"><tbody class="mcnBoxedTextBlockOuter"><tr><td valign="top" class="mcnBoxedTextBlockInner"><table align="left" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="600" class="mcnBoxedTextContentContainer" style="border-collapse: collapse;"><tbody><tr><td style="padding: 9px 18px;"><table border="0" cellpadding="18" cellspacing="0" class="mcnTextContentContainer" width="100%" style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px dashed rgb(255, 255, 255); background-color: rgb(128, 0, 0);"><tbody><tr><td valign="top" class="mcnTextContent" style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 15px; line-height: 22px; Diana

From Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 19:18:55 2014
From: Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu (Toni Saylor)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 19:18:55 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Fridays Beginning This Week!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A46662F0@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Come to the opening night of 4North Fridays, this Friday starting around 6pm.
[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFDDAC.8ABD02F0]
The North End will be open 8-10 serving homemade Tacos, Queso, and Guac and doing a mysterious undetermined craft along with that theme.
The Aire Ni Lounge (properly accented above) will be open at 8:00 with Cards Against Humanity's 4th and 5th expansions and tea.
The Pass No Record will be open 9-12 doing 'the usual.'
The Rock Cavern will be open 9-12 with Guitar Hero and Rock Band.
Midnight Waffles will open at 9:00 with... 9:00 waffles.
Vanilla Dice will be embarking on a quest to reach the famed level 10! But this adventure is not for the faint of heart. Raging Gazebos and Drooling Slime seek our destruction. Only the legendary Boots of Butt-Kicking can save those in danger. Will you be the fortunate soul to find them?  The dungeon door (4N WH 430) will open at 9:00!   Treasure and delicious baked apples<http://i.ebayimg.com/00/s/MTAyMVg2NDU=/z/TkwAAOxy3zNSo3Bo/$_35.JPG> await for any who will brave this dangerous mission with us.


There are rumours that Stop, Pop, and Roll will be open as well as Kreek Life. TBA.

<b><i><span style='color:#C00000'>Cards Against Humanity</span></i></b>&#8217;s<b><i><span style='color:#C00000'> </span></i></b>4<sup>th</sup> and 5<sup>th</sup> expansions<b><i><span From Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 19:23:30 2014
From: Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu (Toni Saylor)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 19:23:30 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Fridays Beginning This Week!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A46662F0@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A46662F0@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A46662F9@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Sorry...

Caf? Diem will be open 9-12 with assorted baked goods.

Mindy and Sophie are amazing and I love them and I hope they forgive me.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor
Sent: Wednesday, October 01, 2014 7:19 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Fridays Beginning This Week!

Come to the opening night of 4North Fridays, this Friday starting around 6pm.
[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFDDAD.2ED51170]
The North End will be open 8-10 serving homemade Tacos, Queso, and Guac and doing a mysterious undetermined craft along with that theme.
The Aire Ni Lounge (properly accented above) will be open at 8:00 with Cards Against Humanity's 4th and 5th expansions and tea.
The Pass No Record will be open 9-12 doing 'the usual.'
The Rock Cavern will be open 9-12 with Guitar Hero and Rock Band.
Midnight Waffles will open at 9:00 with... 9:00 waffles.
Vanilla Dice will be embarking on a quest to reach the famed level 10! But this adventure is not for the faint of heart. Raging Gazebos and Drooling Slime seek our destruction. Only the legendary Boots of Butt-Kicking can save those in danger. Will you be the fortunate soul to find them?  The dungeon door (4N WH 430) will open at 9:00!   Treasure and delicious baked apples<http://i.ebayimg.com/00/s/MTAyMVg2NDU=/z/TkwAAOxy3zNSo3Bo/$_35.JPG> await for any who will brave this dangerous mission with us.


There are rumours that Stop, Pop, and Roll will be open as well as Kreek Life. TBA.

From Alex.Spies at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 19:31:27 2014
From: Alex.Spies at students.olin.edu (Alex Spies)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 19:31:27 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Figure Drawing at Babson
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666306@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi Everyone,

Danielle Krcmar will be teaching Figure Drawing Next Thursday October 9th from 5-7 pm in Trim 215. It's a great opportunity to be able to draw from a live model.  Please RSVP to Babson Professor Danielle Krcmar<mailto:dkrcmar at babson.edu> , usually walk ins are welcome but having an RSVP list helps plan.


-          Alex Spies

	text-decoration:underline;}

	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}

	{mso-style-priority:34;
	margin-top:0in;
	margin-right:0in;
	margin-bottom:0in;
	margin-left:.5in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}

	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}

	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}

	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}

	{page:WordSection1;}

From Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 19:34:06 2014
From: Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu (Ian Hill)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 19:34:06 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] One Act Festival Auditions!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666309@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Just a reminder! Auditions for the One Act Festival will be happening in 30 minutes in the Crescent Room. There are some super fun plays this year! (see below!)

See you there :)


From: Ian Hill
Sent: Sunday, September 28, 2014 10:00 PM
To: fwop at lists.olin.edu; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Cc: Kai Austin; Celina Bekins; Yun-Hsin (Cynthia) Chen; Jennifer Anderson
Subject: One Act Festival Auditions!


[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFDDAE.A94A98C0]
Hi Oliners!
It's time already to audition for the FWOP Fall Family Weekend
One Act Festival!
Auditions will be held
this Wednesday at 8PM
in the Crescent Room
(if you are unable to attend for whatever reason, just send me an email and we will do our best to accommodate you)

This year's One Act Festival will include:
Check Please
By Jonathan Rand
Directed by Celina Bekins '18
See summary -><http://www.playscripts.com/play/202>

Drugs are Bad*
(*casting has already been completed for this play)
By Jonathan Rand
Directed by Cynthia Chen '17
See summary -><http://www.playscripts.com/play/164>

A Game
By Dennis E. Noble
Directed by Jennifer Anderson '16
Read the reviews on Amazon -><http://www.amazon.com/Game-Dennis-E-Noble/dp/0886800625>

Cheesecake & Waffles
By Kai Austin
Directed by Kai Austin '15
Summary: Cari has a crush. When her friend's crack her to find out exactly who, they decide to send her off to an alleged relationship expert by the name of Sevan. The problem is, this is an anti-romantic comedy and Sevan could not care less.

By Kai Austin
Directed by Kai Austin '15
Summary: Cari has a crush. When her friend's crack her to find out exactly who, they decide to send her off to an alleged relationship expert by the name of Sevan. The problem is, this is an anti-romantic comedy and Sevan could not care less.

From Anne.LoVerso at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  1 23:36:41 2014
From: Anne.LoVerso at students.olin.edu (Anne LoVerso)
Date: Wed, 1 Oct 2014 23:36:41 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Education Research Open House
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666488@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Are you interested in Engineering? Education? Research?
(we're looking for new members!)

Want to know more about motivation, pedagogical awareness, or what makes students tick?

Come by AC327 (the EduSpace) Thursday(the 2nd) 12:30 - 1:30 for a Research Open House!

Check out some of the projects current students are working on!
See if you want to get involved!
Meet the coolest research group on campus!


-         Jon Stolk and Zhenya's research groups

Brian

Purchase<http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001syf8NCLLWoD5J2W75W6CMSswk8PAJwsWRNDiclqbCCiAhSuoPp00HG6IPBthmDn2E17ScrqOxeOH2vCqe9cX_6ixepQFeibNtOlqtx7jJYi86QcDAQx8iosMwWvYUWKUrHlGgYlc_WhpyHYN2N0vzEKRZ_g569zmu03Ve9pEQyRDhLeiJCK09JcCMriadGLbBUR6l8Cjmdk1OfxL7WHoaiNnY_m5AGRfUVeVkLo7fMPdNFWTQB5IRQ==&c=bowddg12C0_TNsm0gLn-Ms7AOynmh9tFe30cC7vilFFtvX3Q_8iYWw==&ch=VCx8sdW5A3Uw8WbK5jMoJYgQ3RkBCtYMrUOybSMYxfogrkCKsRgYkg==> your tickets today for best seating!


WEST SIDE STORY is an American award-winning musical adaptation of the classic romantic tragedy, "Romeo and Juliet". The story is set in the Upper West Side neighborhood in New York City in the mid-1950s where rival street gangs (the Jets and the Sharks) battle for territory and respect. The young protagonist, Tony, one of the Jets, falls in love with Maria, the sister of Bernardo, the leader of the Sharks. The dark theme, sophisticated music, extended dance scenes, and focus on social problems marked a turning point in American musical theatre. Bernstein's score for the musical includes "Something's Coming", "Maria", "America", "Somewhere", "Tonight", "Jet Song", "I Feel Pretty", "A Boy Like That", "One Hand, One Heart", "Gee, Officer Krupke", and "Cool".



[http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs195/1106162505442/img/169.jpg]



Directed by Doug Hodge
Music Direction by Chris Holownia
Original Broadway choreography remounted by Katie Alexander



October 17-19 & 24-26, 2014
Times: Friday & Saturday evenings at 8pm /
Sunday matinee at 2pm
Location: The Lowell Mason Theatre
Medfield High School, Medfield, MA
Ticket Price: $30

[http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs195/1106162505442/img/149.jpg]

 We are a non-profit, federal tax exempt 501(c)(3) theatre dedicated to bringing affordable, high-quality musical theatre productions to the metro-west area of Boston. Our goal is to create a place where family and friends can come together and experience an evening of wonderful, imaginative, and meaningful entertainment not far from home.

                  <td rowspan="1" colspan="1"><table style="background-color:#7E9C42;" bgcolor="#7E9C42" border="0" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
                      <tbody><tr>
                        <td style="width:400px;border-top:1px solid #353535;" valign="top" width="400" rowspan="1" colspan="1">
                            <table style="padding-top:10px;padding-bottom:10px;background-color: rgb(0, 36, 74); display: table; " bgcolor="#00244A" border="0" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5" id="content_LETTER.BLOCK3"><tbody><tr><td style="font-family: Tahoma, Geneva, sans-serif; color: #ffffff; text-align: center;" rowspan="1" colspan="1" align="center">
<div style="text-align: center;" align="center"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><br><span style="font-family: 'Segoe UI', 'Lucida Grande', Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">LATEST NEWS FROM WOODLAND THEATRE COMPANY</span></span></div>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
                            
                            
                            
                            <table style="padding-top:10px;padding-bottom:10px;background-color: rgb(0, 36, 74);" bgcolor="#00244A" border="0" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5" id="content_LETTER.BLOCK4"><tbody><tr><td style="text-align: center; color: #ffffff;" rowspan="1" colspan="1" align="center"><img height="317" vspace="5" border="0" name="ACCOUNT.IMAGE.167" hspace="5" width="245" src="http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs195/1106162505442/img/167.jpg"> <br><br>Less than 3 weeks until opening night of West Side Story.<br><br><br>Over 200 tickets SOLD!<br><a style="color: rgb(255, 102, 0); text-decoration: underline;" track="on" shape="rect" href="http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001syf8NCLLWoD5J2W75W6CMSswk8PAJwsWRNDiclqbCCiAhSuoPp00HG6IPBthmDn2E17ScrqOxeOH2vCqe9cX_6ixepQFeibNtOlqtx7jJYi86QcDAQx8iosMwWvYUWKUrHlGgYlc_WhpyHYN2N0vzEKRZ_g569zmu03Ve9pEQyRDhLeiJCK09JcCMriadGLbBUR6l8Cjmdk1OfxL7WHoaiNnY_m5AGRfUVeVkLo7fMPdNFWTQB5IRQ==&amp;c=bowddg12C0_TNsm0gLn-Ms7AOynmh9tFe30cC7vilFFtvX3Q_8iYWw==&amp;ch=VCx8sdW5A3Uw8WbK5jMoJYgQ3RkBCtYMrUOybSMYxfogrkCKsRgYkg==" linktype="1" target="_blank">Purchase</a><span>&nbsp;your tickets today for best seating!</span><br><br><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">WEST SIDE STORY is an American award-winning musical adaptation of the classic romantic tragedy, "Romeo and Juliet". The story is set in the Upper West Side neighborhood in New York City in the mid-1950s where rival street gangs (the Jets and the Sharks) battle for territory and respect. The young protagonist, Tony, one of the Jets, falls in love with Maria, the sister of Bernardo, the leader of the Sharks. The dark theme, sophisticated music, extended dance scenes, and focus on social problems marked a turning point in American musical theatre. Bernstein's score for the musical includes "Something's Coming", "Maria", "America", "Somewhere", "Tonight", "Jet Song", "I Feel Pretty", "A Boy Like That", "One Hand, One Heart", "Gee, Officer Krupke", and "Cool".</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><img vspace="5" name="ACCOUNT.IMAGE.169" border="0" hspace="5" width="379" src="http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs195/1106162505442/img/169.jpg"> &nbsp;</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><span>Directed by Doug Hodge</span><br><span>Music Direction by Chris Holownia</span><br><span>Original Broadway choreography remounted&nbsp;by Katie Alexander</span>&nbsp;</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">&nbsp;</p><div style="text-align: center; color: #ffffff;" align="center">October 17-19 &amp; 24-26, 2014<br></div><div style="color: #ffffff; text-align: center;" align="center"><span style="color: #ffffff;" color="#ffffff">
<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">Times:&nbsp;Friday &amp; Saturday evenings at 8pm /&nbsp;</span></div>
<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">Sunday matinee at 2pm</span>&nbsp;</div>
<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">Location:&nbsp;The Lowell Mason Theatre</span></div>
<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">Medfield High School, Medfield, MA</span>&nbsp;</div>
<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">Ticket Price:&nbsp;$30&nbsp;</span></div>
<br> <img vspace="5" border="0" name="ACCOUNT.IMAGE.149" hspace="5" width="377" src="http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs195/1106162505442/img/149.jpg"> <br><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><br>&nbsp;</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">Read Allison Russell's newest blog&nbsp;</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">"<a style="color: rgb(255, 102, 0); text-decoration: underline;" track="on" href="http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001syf8NCLLWoD5J2W75W6CMSswk8PAJwsWRNDiclqbCCiAhSuoPp00HIxt7VPlQJCWQwigf5xLMgQNHdNhtNBf7QgDfKNfZ04WoyJQI2XsIlV4MBdt4QGC4ex0mHlyHBdvlp_24jkFekAu6hmYZ02mEMWSbjMtIhTMR0pd_9gEqY9zmlB8S9wGZfBekDsA5AmK7og-Yx3OGwk=&amp;c=bowddg12C0_TNsm0gLn-Ms7AOynmh9tFe30cC7vilFFtvX3Q_8iYWw==&amp;ch=VCx8sdW5A3Uw8WbK5jMoJYgQ3RkBCtYMrUOybSMYxfogrkCKsRgYkg==" shape="rect" linktype="1" target="_blank">Theatre for Change</a>"</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><br>&nbsp;</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">&nbsp;</p><div style="color: #ff6600;"><span style="color: #ffffff;">LIKE us on</span>&nbsp;</div><div style="color: #ff6600;"><a style="color: rgb(255, 102, 0); From Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  2 11:20:30 2014
From: Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu (Amanda Lee)
Date: Thu, 2 Oct 2014 11:20:30 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] F.I.L.M Presents: [REC] @ 9:00 PM
Message-ID: <09CAC5BE-B74A-458E-B280-4FA877C3F8BA@students.olin.edu>

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: Rec<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YGJ_jPKOj1c>
9:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:77529BD5-D0D5-4DEF-A066-C2DB5EDD88AF at olin.edu]

It's finally October, so FILM is going to be shifting to horror films (just for this month I promise). [REC] is
 a Spanish found footage film that's been called "one of the best Spanish horror films in recent memory". That being said, I know almost nothing about Spanish horror so I don't know what that means. We're going to see how Thursdays work out (although the time may shift around) so keep that in mind for coming weeks.

Amanda Lee, F.I.L.M. Director
Mary Ruthven, YAY Scary movies
Rachel Mathew, Maybe grilled cheese?
Helen Lyons, 78 minutes

From Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  2 14:28:34 2014
From: Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu (Lyra Silverwolf)
Date: Thu, 2 Oct 2014 14:28:34 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free Broken (?) Scanner
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A30685ED@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi all,

The library has an old HP C7716A scanner (http://www.amazon.com/HP-C7710A-C7716A-ScanJet-7400c/dp/B000COSORA) that we believe is broken and not worth repairing.

If you would like to grab it to take it apart, fix it or do something else crazy with it, please come take it off of our hands.

It is sitting on the counter to the left of the penny machine on the main floor of the library. First come, first served. Please send a resolved if you take it.

-Lyra

From Victoria.Preston at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  2 14:55:53 2014
From: Victoria.Preston at students.olin.edu (Victoria Preston)
Date: Thu, 2 Oct 2014 14:55:53 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Be Awesome - Help Out the Community!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666712@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey all!

Seize the semester!

eDisco needs a few more volunteers who are interested in working with the local public housing authority to mentor/tutor/teach K-8 grade level kids in the community.  Its super fun, and they love hanging out with college kids!

Let me know if you're interested - the time hasn't been set, so we can try to work with your schedule as best we can!

You're awesome!
V

From aaron.greiner at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  2 15:02:24 2014
From: aaron.greiner at students.olin.edu (Aaron Greiner)
Date: Thu, 02 Oct 2014 12:02:24 -0700 (PDT)
Subject: [Carpediem] French Conversation Table
Message-ID: <1412276543733.4a181e33@Nodemailer>

Hi,


I would like to put together a French conversation table at dinner or lunch, so if you speak any French whatsoever (or if you want to learn!), please fill out this whenisgood: http://whenisgood.net/olinfrench


I took French in high school, and I would like to keep it up! Even if you don?t consider yourself proficient in French, still fill out the whenisgood, and come! I myself am not fluent, but I enjoy speaking French.
Again, here is the website:
http://whenisgood.net/olinfrench



Merci :)


-Aaron

From David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  2 15:44:19 2014
From: David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu (David Pudlo)
Date: Thu, 2 Oct 2014 15:44:19 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] ES Talk - Carolyn Finney - Next Thursday 10/9 @ 4:15
In-Reply-To: <DCB4E5D9-32CF-46A0-9A4A-AAD4208D2E28@wellesley.edu>
References: <CA+YDZ7BKpC2X4z1ZsnKbiOLs60H=EV9ijSYhT7mA0JO05=ja4w@mail.gmail.com>
	<DCB4E5D9-32CF-46A0-9A4A-AAD4208D2E28@wellesley.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666767@EXVS01.olin.edu>

This will be a fantastic talk.  It addresses a crucial issue for Environmental Studies -- the intersection of race, identity, and environmental issues.

Please come the first event in the ES fall series on Race, Difference, and the Environment.  Carolyn Finney will lead off by framing important concepts and talking about her recent book, Black Faces, White Spaces: Reimagining the Relationship of African Americans to the Great Outdoors.

Thursday 10/9 @ 4:15pm
PNE Atrium
Snacks and Refreshments!

From Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  2 18:31:46 2014
From: Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu (Kai Austin)
Date: Thu, 2 Oct 2014 18:31:46 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] One Acts - Still looking for people!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666836@EXVS01.olin.edu>

We are in dire need of actors for the One Act Festival, to occur on Family Weekend.
Check Please and A Game are several people short. No one outright as of yet has auditioned for Cheesecake & Waffles (which, setting aside that I wrote it, makes me sad... :().

So if you like comedies and awkward/quirky relationships and want to have a couple of lines where you are part of one for any of the plays, then
LET US KNOW RIGHT NOW!

We are casting on Saturday morning.

Directors to contact:
Check Please - Celina Bekins
A Game - Jennifer Anderson
Cheesecake & Waffles - Kai Austin

Cheers!

No one outright as of yet has auditioned for Cheesecake &amp; Waffles (which, setting aside that I wrote it, makes me sad&#8230; <span style='font-family:Wingdings'>L</span>).<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>So if you like comedies and awkward/quirky relationships and want to have a couple of lines where you are part of one for any of the plays, then <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:20.0pt'>LET US KNOW RIGHT NOW!</span><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>We are casting on Saturday morning.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Directors to contact:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Check Please &#8211; Celina Bekins<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>A Game &#8211; Jennifer Anderson<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Cheesecake &amp; Waffles &#8211; Kai Austin<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Cheers!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Jessica.Sutantio at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  2 20:53:41 2014

Subject: [Carpediem] FEEL MY BUNS
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666901@EXVS01.olin.edu>

[cid:image002.jpg at 01CFDE82.E08C9CA0]

Well, you can feel as many buns as you want (supplied by the dining hall) at the Engineering Discovery meeting tomorrow (Friday, October 3rd) during SERV time at 3:30pm at the DH Mezz. Do you like Toni Saylor, unicorns, enriching the minds of the future? We will be designing awesome, hands-on curriculum, which will be taught at Sprague School and other locations this semester. You don't need any previous experience, just interest and a sense of humor. New members are always welcome! Come by and ask about this semester's activities.

Love,

The Four-ish

P.S. The buns may or may not come with patties.
P.P.S. The buns may or may not be only available during lunch.

From Paige.Cote at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  2 22:17:49 2014
From: Paige.Cote at students.olin.edu (Paige Cote)
Date: Thu, 2 Oct 2014 22:17:49 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Hacking Pediatrics!
Message-ID: <488E604B-BBF3-4C74-B1E6-B732B3C790D0@students.olin.edu>

Hey Carpe!

There?s a pretty rad hackathon coming up from October 17-19 called Hacking Pediatrics. It is hosted by MIT?s Hacking Medicine, an awesome organization that runs several hackathons in the Boston area every year.

Medical hackathons are great because you get to work on real problems in healthcare on teams that usually include everyone from doctors to designers. Teams are formed at the hackathon, so don?t worry if you?re not sure what to work on.

You can find more information and fill out a simple application here: http://www.hackingpediatrics.com/2014-hackathon-20/

Please let me know if you?re interested and we can organize rides! Also feel free to send me any questions you might have.
Paige

P.S. It should also be noted that this is an great hackathon for people of any skill level. If you?ve never been to a hackathon or if you?ve been to hundreds, you will find something cool to work on.

P.P.S. First years, this means you! Take advantage of the glorious opportunity that is Pass No Record and go to a random hackathon.
-------------- next part --------------

From Celine.Ta at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct  3 08:19:21 2014
From: Celine.Ta at students.olin.edu (Celine Ta)
Date: Fri, 3 Oct 2014 08:19:21 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] MIT Mini Maker Faire Tomorrow
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666AA0@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi Carpe,

This is short notice, but MIT will have a maker faire w/ about 130 makers. It's tomorrow, Saturday, October 4. For those who are going in for HackMIT already, you can drop by before check-in closes (between 9 am- 11 am). http://makerfaire.mit.edu/

Some highlighted makers from their website:

Eric Haines created Mineways<http://www.realtimerendering.com/erich/minecraft/public/mineways/mineways.html>, "an open source, free program that helps you 3D print anything you built in Minecraft. "
The Artisan's Asylum<http://artisansasylum.com/site/> is a non-profit community craft studio located in Somerville, Massachusetts.
Jessica Kramer<http://www.hawkhouse.net/> combines natural elements like crystals and fossils to create unique jewelry items.
Dane Kouttron<http://transistor-man.com/Index.html> will be demonstrating the Flying Nimbus, a single-wheeled, self-balancing electric skateboard.
Ariel Segall<https://plus.google.com/110166416634356803021/posts> will be teaching and demonstrating the old-fashioned art of hand-tooling designs into leather.
Nancy Ouyang is one of the founders of Narwhal Edu<http://narwhaledu.com/>, making educational robots that teach programming, robotics and music!
-------------- next part --------------

It&#8217;s tomorrow, Saturday, October 4. For those who are going in for HackMIT already, you can drop by before check-in closes (between 9 am- 11 am). <a href="http://makerfaire.mit.edu/">http://makerfaire.mit.edu/</a> <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Some highlighted makers from their website: <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><span From Anne.LoVerso at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct  3 12:37:15 2014
From: Anne.LoVerso at students.olin.edu (Anne LoVerso)
Date: Fri, 3 Oct 2014 12:37:15 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Circus Arts
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666BB9@EXVS01.olin.edu>

tl;dr: Aerial circus classes. Monday evenings.  Join us.

Hi all,
Myself and about four or five other students are going to start attending weekly aerial circus classes off-campus as a Passionate Pursuits.  We're planning to go Mondays, leaving Olin at about 6:15pm and returning at 9pm.  We'll all drive together with the Olin Van so don't worry about transportation.

We're going to our first class this Monday 10/6, and if you think you're interested in joining us, your first class is free, so you can come and see if you like it or not.  Email me back if you're interested or want more information!


-------------- next part --------------

Reminder that this is happening in 1020 seconds at the DH Mezz!

From: Jessica Sutantio
Sent: Thursday, October 02, 2014 8:54 PM
To: ediscovery at lists.olin.edu; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: FEEL MY BUNS

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFDF1C.AC9A5EB0]

Well, you can feel as many buns as you want (supplied by the dining hall) at the Engineering Discovery meeting tomorrow (Friday, October 3rd) during SERV time at 3:30pm at the DH Mezz. Do you like Toni Saylor, unicorns, enriching the minds of the future? We will be designing awesome, hands-on curriculum, which will be taught at Sprague School and other locations this semester. You don't need any previous experience, just interest and a sense of humor. New members are always welcome! Come by and ask about this semester's activities.

Love,

The Four-ish

P.S. The buns may or may not come with patties.
P.P.S. The buns may or may not be only available during lunch.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Dakota Nelson
Sent: Tuesday, September 30, 2014 9:04 PM

Subject: [Carpediem] Foundry Office Hours

Hey everyone!

A few Foundry members will be holding office hours in the Foundry space, CC300, at 5:00 on Friday until the Foundry meeting at 6:00.

Come by if you...

*         Want resume tips!

*         Want to know more about the startup fair!

*         Want to know what the startup scene in Boston is like!

*         Want a job! With a startup! (Or not a startup.)

*         Want to talk about entrepreneurship and starting a company!

*         Are curious about the Foundry!

*         Are awesome!

It'll be great. Also, if you have a suggestion for a less boring name than "office hours," come on by and tell us.

See you all at 5:00 on Friday!


Dakota on behalf of the Foundry

To: 'carpediem at lists.olin.edu'
Subject: [Carpediem] Legend of Korra Premiere Event

CALLING ALL BENDERS, NONBENDERS, AND SPIRITS!

The Legend of Korra
Book 4: Balance

SEASON PREMIERE event
Friday, October 3, 2014

West hall 4N: room 427

6:00 PM: Popcorn Begins
6:30 PM: Showing Begins

Join us in the start of a new adventure, and the final one in the avatar universe.

Sincerely,

Avatar Subhash

From Tatiana.Anthony at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct  3 17:59:37 2014
From: Tatiana.Anthony at students.olin.edu (Tatiana Anthony)
Date: Fri, 3 Oct 2014 17:59:37 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Fridays Beginning This Week!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A46662F9@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A46662F0@EXVS01.olin.edu>
	<DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A46662F9@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666D99@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Just a reminder, tonight is the opening night of 4 North Fridays!
Join:

?         Stop, Pop, and Roll at 6:15,

?         The North End and The Aire Ni Lounge at 8, and

?         The Pass No Record, The Rock Cavern, Midnight Waffles, and Vanilla Dice at 9
In WH4N!

Descriptions of events are listed below.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor
Sent: Wednesday, October 01, 2014 7:24 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] 4N Fridays Beginning This Week!

Sorry...

Caf? Diem will be open 9-12 with assorted baked goods.

Mindy and Sophie are amazing and I love them and I hope they forgive me.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor
Sent: Wednesday, October 01, 2014 7:19 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Fridays Beginning This Week!

Come to the opening night of 4North Fridays, this Friday starting around 6pm.
[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFDF33.CB2FFE40]
The North End will be open 8-10 serving homemade Tacos, Queso, and Guac and doing a mysterious undetermined craft along with that theme.
The Aire Ni Lounge (properly accented above) will be open at 8:00 with Cards Against Humanity's 4th and 5th expansions and tea.
The Pass No Record will be open 9-12 doing 'the usual.'
The Rock Cavern will be open 9-12 with Guitar Hero and Rock Band.
Midnight Waffles will open at 9:00 with... 9:00 waffles.
Vanilla Dice will be embarking on a quest to reach the famed level 10! But this adventure is not for the faint of heart. Raging Gazebos and Drooling Slime seek our destruction. Only the legendary Boots of Butt-Kicking can save those in danger. Will you be the fortunate soul to find them?  The dungeon door (4N WH 430) will open at 9:00!   Treasure and delicious baked apples<http://i.ebayimg.com/00/s/MTAyMVg2NDU=/z/TkwAAOxy3zNSo3Bo/$_35.JPG> await for any who will brave this dangerous mission with us.


There are rumours that Stop, Pop, and Roll will be open as well as Kreek Life. TBA.

style='font-size:14.0pt'> </span>will be embarking on a quest to reach the famed level 10! But this adventure is not for the faint of heart. <b>Raging Gazebos</b> and <b>Drooling Slime</b> seek our destruction. Only the legendary <b>Boots of Butt-Kicking</b> can save those in danger. Will you be the fortunate soul to find them?&nbsp; The dungeon door (4N WH 430) will open at <b><span style='color:red'>9:00</span></b>!&nbsp;&nbsp; Treasure and <a href="http://i.ebayimg.com/00/s/MTAyMVg2NDU=/z/TkwAAOxy3zNSo3Bo/$_35.JPG">delicious baked apples</a><span style='color:red'> </span>await for any who will brave this dangerous mission with us.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>There are rumours that <b><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Stop, Pop, and Roll</span></b> will be open as well as <b><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Kreek Life</span></b>. TBA.<span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:14.0pt;font-family:Vivaldi'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

Just a reminder, tonight is the opening night of 4 North Fridays!

?         Stop, Pop, and Roll at 6:15,

?         The North End and The Aire Ni Lounge at 8, and

?         The Pass No Record, The Rock Cavern, Midnight Waffles, and Vanilla Dice at 9
In WH4N!

Descriptions of events are listed below.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor
Sent: Wednesday, October 01, 2014 7:19 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Fridays Beginning This Week!

Come to the opening night of 4North Fridays, this Friday starting around 6pm.
<image001.jpg>
The North End will be open 8-10 serving homemade Tacos, Queso, and Guac and doing a mysterious undetermined craft along with that theme.
The Aire Ni Lounge (properly accented above) will be open at 8:00 with Cards Against Humanity?s 4th and 5th expansions and tea.
The Pass No Record will be open 9-12 doing ?the usual.?
The Rock Cavern will be open 9-12 with Guitar Hero and Rock Band.
Midnight Waffles will open at 9:00 with? 9:00 waffles.
Vanilla Dice will be embarking on a quest to reach the famed level 10! But this adventure is not for the faint of heart. Raging Gazebos and Drooling Slime seek our destruction. Only the legendary Boots of Butt-Kicking can save those in danger. Will you be the fortunate soul to find them?  The dungeon door (4N WH 430) will open at 9:00!   Treasure and delicious baked apples<http://i.ebayimg.com/00/s/MTAyMVg2NDU=/z/TkwAAOxy3zNSo3Bo/$_35.JPG> await for any who will brave this dangerous mission with us.


There are rumours that Stop, Pop, and Roll will be open as well as Kreek Life. TBA.

class="MsoNormal"><b><span style="font-size:14.0pt;font-family:Vivaldi">Vanilla Dice</span></b><span style="font-size:14.0pt"> </span>will be embarking on a quest to reach the famed level 10! But this adventure is not for the faint of heart. <b>Raging Gazebos</b> and <b>Drooling Slime</b> seek our destruction. Only the legendary <b>Boots of Butt-Kicking</b> can save those in danger. Will you be the fortunate soul to find them?&nbsp; The dungeon door (4N WH 430) will open at <b><span style="color:red">9:00</span></b>!&nbsp;&nbsp; Treasure and <a href="http://i.ebayimg.com/00/s/MTAyMVg2NDU=/z/TkwAAOxy3zNSo3Bo/$_35.JPG">delicious baked apples</a><span style="color:red"> </span>await for any who will brave this dangerous mission with us.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">There are rumours that <b><span style="font-size:14.0pt">Stop, Pop, and Roll</span></b> will be open as well as <b><span style="font-size:14.0pt">Kreek Life</span></b>. From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor
Sent: Wednesday, October 01, 2014 7:24 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>

Caf? Diem will be open 9-12 with assorted baked goods.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor
Sent: Wednesday, October 01, 2014 7:19 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Fridays Beginning This Week!

Come to the opening night of 4North Fridays, this Friday starting around 6pm.
<image001.jpg>
The North End will be open 8-10 serving homemade Tacos, Queso, and Guac and doing a mysterious undetermined craft along with that theme.
The Aire Ni Lounge (properly accented above) will be open at 8:00 with Cards Against Humanity?s 4th and 5th expansions and tea.
The Pass No Record will be open 9-12 doing ?the usual.?
The Rock Cavern will be open 9-12 with Guitar Hero and Rock Band.
Midnight Waffles will open at 9:00 with? 9:00 waffles.
Vanilla Dice will be embarking on a quest to reach the famed level 10! But this adventure is not for the faint of heart. Raging Gazebos and Drooling Slime seek our destruction. Only the legendary Boots of Butt-Kicking can save those in danger. Will you be the fortunate soul to find them?  The dungeon door (4N WH 430) will open at 9:00!   Treasure and delicious baked apples<http://i.ebayimg.com/00/s/MTAyMVg2NDU=/z/TkwAAOxy3zNSo3Bo/$_35.JPG> await for any who will brave this dangerous mission with us.


There are rumours that Stop, Pop, and Roll will be open as well as Kreek Life. TBA.

From Elizabeth.Mahon at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct  3 20:46:25 2014
From: Elizabeth.Mahon at students.olin.edu (Elizabeth Mahon)
Date: Fri, 3 Oct 2014 20:46:25 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Smash Bros Tournament
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666E18@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey all!

Whether you have the new Smash Bros or not, you can participate in an official Nintendo-sponsored tournament tomorrow! It's from 11 to unspecified, but it's first-come first-serve and lines start at 9, so we'd probably leave closer to 8:30. More details:

http://www.nintendo.com/whatsnew/detail/YS1alkSYYq0lakj7t5FuBJFMmbRaQM-A

If you're interested, please email me!

Elizabeth

	font-family:"Times","serif";
	color:windowtext;}

	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}

	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}

	{page:WordSection1;}

From Amon.Millner at olin.edu  Sat Oct  4 00:05:24 2014
From: Amon.Millner at olin.edu (Amon Millner)
Date: Sat, 4 Oct 2014 00:05:24 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] MIT Media Lab Open House - October 27th
In-Reply-To: <CAMO4d85h1YLaxkwJoGxjpNKdDTsLu7iofpWFrp37BJAiRLgSgw@mail.gmail.com>
References: <CAMO4d85h1YLaxkwJoGxjpNKdDTsLu7iofpWFrp37BJAiRLgSgw@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <D054E830.A5AE%amon.millner@olin.edu>

Mark your calendars for two upcoming opportunities to learn about the MIT Media Lab as a post-Olin option. On Thursday October 9th at 8:30PM, Juliana Nazare and I will be hosting an info session at Olin (location TBD) about graduate school at the Media Lab. On October 27th, the Media Lab admission folks are hosting an Open House ? see below.

??

The MIT Media Lab<http://www.media.mit.edu/> is hosting an Open House<http://media.mit.edu/admissions/open-house-info> for prospective students. Please share this information with anyone considering a graduate program that provides the opportunity to create technology that will change the world.

Open House Highlights

 *   Opportunity to interact with up to two of the Lab's research groups
 *   Meet faculty and graduate students
 *   Experience the Lab's signature demo culture and experiment with revolutionary technology
 *   Learn about the Lab's diverse research foci including sociable robots, innovative interface design, smart prostheses, and viral communications
 *   Discover how you can become a part of this vibrant community by applying to the graduate program
 *   Free registration (travel costs are the responsibility of the attendee)

Register here: http://www.media.mit.edu/admissions/open-house

Questions? Contact mas at media.mit.edu<mailto:mas at media.mit.edu>

Take care,
AM

From Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu  Sat Oct  4 13:04:54 2014
From: Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu (Ian Hill)
Date: Sat, 4 Oct 2014 13:04:54 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] NEF Council on Competitiveness
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4666EFA@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Tl;dr Do you want to meet executives from Dassault Syst?mes or Lockheed Martin? We need 8 scribes for the National Engineering Forum's Council on Competitiveness on Monday, October 27th. The event is low time commitment, you don't even have to leave campus, and you can meet experts in industry and academia!
[cid:image002.png at 01CFDFD3.CA96AEC0]

Summary
On Monday, October 27th from 6PM-9PM, Olin College will be hosting the National Engineering Forum Council on Competitiveness, and we need 8 student scribes for the discussion.

Topic of Discussion
Join in an exclusive, invite-only dialogue with New England area leaders from industry, academia, government and other sectors to discuss solutions to the engineering crises of capacity, capability, and competitiveness based on the distinctiveness of the Greater Boston region.

Notable Attendees
The evening will begin with cocktails and presentations from:

Al Bunshaft, President and CEO, Dassault Syst?mes Americas: See Bio<http://www.olin.edu/about/presidents-council/al-bunshaft/>
Jeffery J. Wilcox, Vice President of Engineering, Lockheed Martin: See Bio<http://www.lockheedmartin.com/us/who-we-are/leadership/wilcox.html>
Deborah L. Wince-Smith, President and CEO, Council on Competitiveness: See Bio<http://www.compete.org/about-us/president/deborah-l-wince-smith/>

Schedule
MONDAY, OCTOBER 27, 2014
6:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. Cocktail Reception
7:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. Dinner, Keynote, and Roundtable Discussion

Are you interested?
If you are interested in being one of the 8 scribes, please reply to this email! This is a rare opportunity to meet and converse with experts in industry and academia. The National Engineering Forum is looking to identify the scribes for this event as soon as possible.

All the best,
Ian Hill

-------------- next part --------------

From Manik.Sethi at students.olin.edu  Sun Oct  5 01:15:42 2014
From: Manik.Sethi at students.olin.edu (Manik Sethi)
Date: Sun, 5 Oct 2014 01:15:42 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Model UN Meeting Recap
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A466713F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

SO we didn't get much of a turn out at the meeting on Friday but it's ok, many people have approached me with interest in MUN. Basically, we had a recap of "what is model UN" and "what we could do as a team." During this week, I will ask IT to set up a mailing list and we will pick up the conversation from there. Please reach out to Mike Costello or myself about any thoughts you have on MUN or GCSP and we want to make sure you guys can make the most out of your experience.

Regards,
Manik Singh Sethi

From Philip.Seger at students.olin.edu  Sun Oct  5 16:38:31 2014
From: Philip.Seger at students.olin.edu (Philip Seger)
Date: Sun, 5 Oct 2014 16:38:31 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] REsolved: Selling SSD
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F90CF@EXVS01.olin.edu>



From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Philip Seger
Sent: Sunday, October 5, 2014 2:37 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Selling SSD

I ran out of space so decided to upgrade to a larger SSD. The one I'm selling is an Intel 520 series with 180GB of storage. I've had it for about a year and it is in perfect health.

More info: http://ark.intel.com/products/66249/Intel-SSD-520-Series-180GB-2_5in-SATA-6Gbs-25nm-MLC

$80 OBO

Philip Seger

From Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu  Sun Oct  5 18:36:17 2014
From: Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu (Dakota Nelson)
Date: Sun, 5 Oct 2014 18:36:17 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free Food & Networking Thursday Night
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F9154@EXVS01.olin.edu>

"Join us October 9 for the next Reality Computing Boston Meetup, once again in the awesomeMassChallenge space at the Innovation and Design Building in Boston's Innovation District.

There will be plenty of time for networking with innovative, entrepreneurial, like-minded individuals from the Boston tech scene, and some time at the end for brief shout-outs from attendees. Pizza and appropriate beverages provided.

Featured presentations and demos include:

Dominique Pouliquen of Autodesk: 3D photo-based imaging for the real world.

Heuristic Labs: Mobile 3D imaging using structured light detection and ranging technology; creators of LazeeEye.

NVBOTS: A MassChallenge finalist building automated 3D printers with the goal of inspiring innovation and creativity in students around the world.

...and several more to be confirmed. Interested in presenting on a Reality Computing topic? Contact the organizer for more information.

Networking and food start at 6pm, presentations at 7pm."

http://www.greenhornconnect.com/event/reality-computing-boston-meetup/



Dakota Nelson | Class of 2017
Tel: 605-877-4076 | URL: www.dakotanelson.com<http://www.dakotanelson.com/>
[cid:image001.png at 01CFE0CB.3FE63C70]

	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

From Griffin.Tschurwald at students.olin.edu  Sun Oct  5 23:50:12 2014
From: Griffin.Tschurwald at students.olin.edu (Griffin Tschurwald)
Date: Sun, 5 Oct 2014 23:50:12 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Olin Exclusive Ice Skating
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F930D@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Yep, it's here.
First Oliners only ice skating event of the year! Come skate around a big ice rink with all your friends, or alone! Experience the joy of ice before winter comes and you hate it! Pass no Record #YOLO!
Total beginners to Charlie Whites encouraged to attend!
Wednesday, October 15th at 11pm. Until 11:50pm.
Free skating + free skate rentals at the rink . Free Ical attached!
Included is a map showing the suggested walking route to get to the rink. It's super duper close by!
Skates are limited in quantity, and are first come first serve. Come at 10:45 to get your hands on a pair and start lacing up! Or bring your own skates!


[cid:image004.jpg at 01CFE0F7.1A4C5DB0]

Haha bears can't skate!
[cid:image005.jpg at 01CFE0F7.1A4C5DB0]

Griffin Crooke Tschurwald
262-366-4594
Olin College of Engineering

If you've ever wanted to own Carcassonne, Cranium, Risk, Chess, The Invention Game, or Epic Spell Wars of Battle Wizards - now is your chance. The games will be hanging out on the counter between the printer and the penny machine until tomorrow afternoon when they will be thrown out.

-Lyra

From Emily.Guthrie at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct  6 12:03:54 2014
From: Emily.Guthrie at students.olin.edu (Emily Guthrie)
Date: Mon, 6 Oct 2014 12:03:54 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Hack Holyoke Signup
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F9501@EXVS01.olin.edu>

TL:DR Fill out this google doc to https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1VJR5hBKHCLf0UErr2YPHrMLHioKkIZUKKPsYvW6hVv4/edit?usp=sharing plan teams and attendance for Hack Holyoke

Hack Holyoke is in MA on November 7th and 8th  and it's going to be an embedded systems hack which means all Oliners are well suited to go. We're just going to play with the electrical, mechanical, and software intersection. The hackathon is 24 hours and it's a great opportunity to learn, work on cool pet projects, and hang out with friends. They are looking for a 1:1 ratio of gender so Olin is well suited to send teams!

Thanks,
Let me know if you have any questions

Emily
-------------- next part --------------

<o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1" />
</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal>TL:DR Fill out this google doc to <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1VJR5hBKHCLf0UErr2YPHrMLHioKkIZUKKPsYvW6hVv4/edit?usp=sharing">https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1VJR5hBKHCLf0UErr2YPHrMLHioKkIZUKKPsYvW6hVv4/edit?usp=sharing</a> plan teams and attendance for Hack Holyoke<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Hack Holyoke is in MA on November 7<sup>th</sup> and 8<sup>th</sup> &nbsp;and it&#8217;s going to be an embedded systems hack which means all Oliners are well suited to go. We&#8217;re just going to play with the electrical, mechanical, and software intersection. The hackathon is 24 hours and it&#8217;s a great opportunity to learn, work on cool pet projects, and hang out with friends. They are looking for a 1:1 ratio of gender so Olin is well suited to send teams!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Thanks,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Let me know if you have any questions<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Emily<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Alyson.Goodrow at olin.edu  Mon Oct  6 12:10:17 2014
From: Alyson.Goodrow at olin.edu (Alyson Goodrow)
Date: Mon, 6 Oct 2014 12:10:17 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] KPCB Fellows Program - deadline to apply is 10/31
Message-ID: <D0583729.309EA%alyson.goodrow@olin.edu>

Hi, all -
Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers (www.kpcb.com), a world-leading venture capital firm located in Silicon Valley, just announced that they are now accepting applications for the 2015 KPCB Engineering Fellows Program and we?d like to share this opportunity with you.

The KPCB Fellows Program offers top college students an opportunity to gain significant experience working on unique and challenging technical, design and product problems. Over the course of a summer, fellows are employed at up-and-coming Silicon Valley startups, are mentored by executives within the company and invited to attend events with industry CEOs, leaders and executives. Fellows have worked at companies like Square, Nest, Flipboard, Coursera, Zynga, Indiegogo and many others.

To learn more and apply visit http://www.kpcbfellows.com<http://www.kpcbfellows.com/>. Margaret-Ann Seger<margaret-ann.seger at alumni.olin.edu> ?13 participated in this program in 2012 I?m sure she?d be happy to answer any questions you might have.

Thanks!
-Alyson

Links to recent news articles about the program:

Techcrunch
** http://techcrunch.com/2013/10/03/kleiner-perkins-adds-year-long-product-manager-track-to-design-and-engineering-fellows-program/

Fast Company
** http://www.fastcompany.com/3019060/fast-feed/kleiner-perkins-launches-fellows-program-to-attract-young-product-managers

The Next Web
**http://thenextweb.com/insider/2013/10/03/kleiner-perkins-unveils-new-product-focused-fellowship-and-announces-2014-program-application-dates/
___________________________


Alyson Goodrow| Associate Director of Marketing
Tel: 781-292-2257 | URL: olin.edu
Leading the Revolution in Engineering Education

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct  6 14:10:11 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Mon, 6 Oct 2014 14:10:11 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Incredible jazz guitar concert
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F95C8@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Frank Vignola is by far the most amazing guitarist I've seen. He's going to be playing in Somerville on Friday, December 5* for $20, and I so so so so so want to see him again. If you're interested in one of the most technically jaw-dropping concerts of your life, let me know and we'll work it out!

Video proof that Frank is incredible: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4kBowckwLWM
Concert info: http://www.ticketweb.com/t3/sale/SaleEventDetail?dispatch=loadSelectionData&eventId=5392315

*Yes, this is two months away and tickets are at-the-door. Mostly I was afraid that unless I sent this email I would forget and miss it, which would make me sad. I'll send another one as we get closer.

Subject: [Carpediem] FW: Sukkah sleepover

[cid:image001.gif at 01CFE17A.30FFBD80]Join JOO Club on Thursday for an amazing opportunity to sleep under the stars! We will be playing games, eating snacks and possibly making the most incredible mini- Sukkah's... in the Sukkah! If you have ideas of things we can do in the Sukkah, let me know. Everyone is welcome!

Come to just hang out, just to sleep or for the entire fun night!

<3 Jamie
Questions, comments, concerns, please reply!

Jamie Gorson | Class of 2016
Leading the Revolution in Engineering Education
[cid:image002.png at 01CFE17A.30FFBD80]

From Slater.Victoroff at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct  6 15:52:55 2014
From: Slater.Victoroff at students.olin.edu (Slater Victoroff)
Date: Mon, 6 Oct 2014 15:52:55 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] write for indico
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A325E0C1@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi everyone!

Want to learn some machine learning, concretely help people enter the field and get paid while doing it?

indico is looking for technical writers! Basically if you're willing to write documentation, blog posts, tutorials, anything of the kind we're willing to pay you for it!

Pay will be $50-200 for an appropriately scoped project (i.e. a blog post, not a docstring)

Reach out to me(or any of the other indico people you know. General formula is <first-name>@indico.io) at slater at indico.io if you're interested!

Slater

a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
p.MsoAcetate, li.MsoAcetate, div.MsoAcetate
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text Char";
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

From Jessica.Townsend at olin.edu  Mon Oct  6 18:00:33 2014
From: Jessica.Townsend at olin.edu (Jessica Townsend)
Date: Mon, 6 Oct 2014 18:00:33 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] FW: Blue Origin at Olin
In-Reply-To: <10c9bf43775e42798a41944dc08f5d39@MAIL01.blueorigin.com>
References: <10c9bf43775e42798a41944dc08f5d39@MAIL01.blueorigin.com>
Message-ID: <D05888C7.5DB23%jessica.townsend@olin.edu>

Hi Everyone,

Just wanted to make sure you all heard about the Blue Origin info session tomorrow night. This is where I spent my sabbatical a few years ago, and it was pretty awesome to get to be a rocket scientist again. They are really excited to meet more Olin students and are always eager to get intern applicants from Olin.

I hope you can make the info session, or look for Heather at the career fair on Wednesday.

Rockets are awesome.

Jessica


From: Heather Nelson <HNelson at blueorigin.com<mailto:HNelson at blueorigin.com>>
Date: Sunday, October 5, 2014 5:30 PM
To: Katherine Maschan <Katherine.Maschan at students.olin.edu<mailto:Katherine.Maschan at students.olin.edu>>, Christopher Joyce <Christopher.Joyce at students.olin.edu<mailto:Christopher.Joyce at students.olin.edu>>, Morgan Bassford <Morgan.Bassford at students.olin.edu<mailto:Morgan.Bassford at students.olin.edu>>, Suzanne Alcott <Suzanne.Alcott at olin.edu<mailto:Suzanne.Alcott at olin.edu>>, Jessica Townsend <jessica.townsend at olin.edu<mailto:jessica.townsend at olin.edu>>
Subject: Blue Origin at Olin

Dear Jessica, Suzanne, Kate, Chris, and Morgan,

Following is the announcement for the information session with Blue Origin on Tuesday. Please forward to anyone you think might be interested in attending or faculty who would be willing to share the announcement with students. Also attached is a .pdf flyer with the same information.

Thank you!

All the best,
Heather

BLUE ORIGIN AT OLIN

TUESDAY, OCTOBER 7, 2014
126 ACADEMIC CENTER, 6:15 PM

Representatives from Blue Origin, LLC will be on campus on this Tuesday at 6:15 p.m. in 126 Academic Center to discuss internship, co-op, and full time opportunities. All students are welcome and pizza will be provided.

Blue Origin interns participate in real engineering design projects related to the development and construction of human space flight systems. Interns work directly with our engineers to contribute to project goals in the fields of mechanical design, fluids, aerodynamics, rocket propulsion, flight controls, electronics, avionics, enterprise software, flight software, composites, chemistry, human safety, and systems engineering. Working directly with our team, students gain real-life experience that allows them to apply classroom learning to real aerospace challenges.

Current students in engineering, science, and technology are invited to apply for this 10-week program. Internships are typically conducted in the summer, but they are also available during the spring and fall academic calendar. Most Blue Origin internships are available at our facility in Kent, Washington, but we also have some opportunities at our facility in West Texas. Our interns receive housing and a competitive compensation package including travel reimbursement.

If you unable to attend the information session but are interested in opportunities at Blue Origin, please see our website www.blueorigin.com<http://www.blueorigin.com>.

Applicants must be a United States citizen, permanent resident alien, or otherwise able to review all export-controlled technical information.

*********************
Heather Nelson
University Outreach Manager
Blue Origin

From Isaac.Getto at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct  6 22:41:05 2014
From: Isaac.Getto at students.olin.edu (Isaac Getto)
Date: Mon, 6 Oct 2014 22:41:05 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Casino Royale
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F9945@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello friends!

Take a chance and come to Casino Royale this Friday night for a night of gambling, classy food, and even classier people. The games begin at 8:00 PM on Friday, and the stakes are high: you will receive $184*  at the beginning of the night, and you will have to swindle, gamble, and con your way to victory. The wealthiest person at the end of the night will receive a SUITCASE FILLED WITH DIAMONDS**, so come dressed in your classiest attire and show us what you've got! May the best gambler win.

Love,
$AC    [cid:image001.jpg at 01CFE1B6.9D3557D0]

*(of totally real $AC BUX)
**actually probably some kind of gift card

May the best gambler win.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:20.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:20.0pt;font-family:"Berlin Sans FB Demi","sans-serif"'>Love,</span><span style='font-size:30.0pt;font-family:"Berlin Sans FB Demi","sans-serif"'> </span><span style='font-size:20.0pt;font-family:"Berlin Sans FB Demi","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:30.0pt;font-family:"Berlin Sans FB Demi","sans-serif";color:#00B050'>$AC</span><span style='font-size:30.0pt;font-family:"Berlin Sans FB Demi","sans-serif"'> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<img width=56 height=45 id="Picture_x0020_1" src="cid:image001.jpg at 01CFE1B6.9D3557D0" alt="cid:image001.jpg at 01CFE1B2.E3384DE0"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:9.0pt'>*(of totally real $AC BUX)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:9.0pt'>**actually probably some kind of gift card<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Isaac.Getto at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct  6 22:42:15 2014
From: Isaac.Getto at students.olin.edu (Isaac Getto)
Date: Mon, 6 Oct 2014 22:42:15 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Casino Royale, with iCal
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F9947@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello friends!

Take a chance and come to Casino Royale this Friday night for a night of gambling, classy food, and even classier people. The games begin at 8:00 PM on Friday, and the stakes are high: you will receive $184*  at the beginning of the night, and you will have to swindle, gamble, and con your way to victory. The wealthiest person at the end of the night will receive a SUITCASE FILLED WITH DIAMONDS**, so come dressed in your classiest attire and show us what you've got! May the best gambler win.

Love,
$AC    [cid:image001.jpg at 01CFE1B6.C6AB8260]

*(of totally real $AC BUX)
**actually probably some kind of gift card

From Isaac.Getto at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct  6 22:53:04 2014
From: Isaac.Getto at students.olin.edu (Isaac Getto)
Date: Mon, 6 Oct 2014 22:53:04 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] will you be my dealer?
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F9951@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello!

Do you like dealing? Well, we need three or more poker dealers for Casino Royale this Friday night, Oct. 10. This event will start at 8PM. Dealers on the blackjack table get to keep their winnings and Texas Hold'em dealers will be given extra chips. At the end of the night, the person with the most chips will get a prize :)
Please let me know soon if you'd like to take part.

Isaac Getto
isaac.getto at students.olin.edu<mailto:isaac.getto at students.olin.edu>

I am just curious<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'>James Nee<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><div><div style='border:none;border-top:solid #B5C4DF 1.0pt;padding:3.0pt 0in 0in 0in'><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>From:</span></b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'> Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] <b>On Behalf Of </b>James Nee<br><b>Sent:</b> Monday, October 06, 2014 11:02 PM<br><b>To:</b> carpediem at lists.olin.edu<br><b>Subject:</b> [Carpediem] Free Motors<o:p></o:p></span></p></div></div><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>I pulled some motors off a wheelchair for my power sled project but despite my desire to restart it &#8211; I have now since completely given up on it. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>My loss is your gain! From Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu  Tue Oct  7 13:45:27 2014
From: Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu (Dakota Nelson)
Date: Tue, 7 Oct 2014 13:45:27 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Drive for Startup Fair & Meet Awesome Companies
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F9C2C@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey!

The Foundry needs drivers to bring startups from Eliot to Olin for the startup fair next Wednesday.

If you're Olin van trained, or willing to use your own car, this is an awesome opportunity to get one-on-one time with really awesome startups!

We need one driver to bring companies from the T to Olin between 11:00ish and 12:00, and a second driver to bring them back from 1:30ish to 2:30. There are currently only six companies that need rides, so it shouldn't be many trips. Let me know if you're interested.


Dakota

Tel: 605-877-4076 | URL: www.dakotanelson.com<http://www.dakotanelson.com/>

	{mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text Char";
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.EmailStyle19
	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.EmailStyle20
	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

From Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu  Tue Oct  7 20:39:42 2014
From: Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu (Ian Hill)
Date: Tue, 7 Oct 2014 20:39:42 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Student Government Tutorial and Workshop
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A49F9E75@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Just a reminder:
The Student Government Tutorial & Workshop will be happening at 9PM tonight in the auditorium.
See you there!

From: Ian Hill
Sent: Monday, October 06, 2014 11:50 AM
To: Students - Class of 2018; Students - Class of 2017; Students - Class of 2016; Students - Class of 2015
Subject: Student Government Tutorial and Workshop

[cid:image002.png at 01CFE15B.A7216190]

Hi Oliners!
Do you want to know...
...how Student Government works at Olin?
...what 'Student Experience Organizations' are?
...where Honor Board, SERV, SAC, and SAO fit in this big picture?
...who your elected representatives are?
... who to talk to when you have a question about college policy?
...how your money is being spent and who decides where it's goes?

Do you want to help improve our current system?

CORe will be holding a
Student Government Tutorial and Workshop
tomorrow, Tuesday, October 7th from 9PM-10PM
in the Milas Hall Auditorium

We intend to hold a second Tutorial and Workshop on a different day to accommodate other students' schedules. There is no ideal time to hold this meeting, so if you wish to attend but cannot due to scheduling conflicts, please reply to this email, and we will attempt to plan the next workshop at a more convenient time.

So I have a Mini Diana that I've been hanging on to for years in hopes that
I'll have the time, but let's be honest I will never.

This one:
http://www.amazon.com/Lomography-Diana-Mini--35mm-Camera/dp/B002SSU4AI/

It has a half-shot roll of film in it from when I was in high school (no
idea what I shot pictures of, to be honest).

It's yours for $15 (and it comes with a book too!).
If you buy it and find that it's broken I'll gladly give you your money
back, but it's literally been in a box for 6+ years so it should be okay.

From Mary Morse, who is away interning at AutoDesk this semester:
Autodesk is offering free access to any of their desktop software for students, teachers and educational institutions. This is a huge value and I highly encourage everyone to take advantage of this.

Visit students.autodesk.com<http://www.autodesk.com/education/home> to download.

Have fun designing!

-Mary

From Bernard.Kahle at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  8 01:00:34 2014
From: Bernard.Kahle at students.olin.edu (Bernard Kahle)
Date: Wed, 8 Oct 2014 01:00:34 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] SLAC This Week
Message-ID: <210F9500-ADEA-46B4-BB18-75B8732D04BC@students.olin.edu>

Join us at SLAC this week for some awesome activities:

- PGP Technical Interview Panel: Learn interview skills! (7:30pm AC113)
- PyCharmers: Objects, Classes, Graphics! (9pm EH2, Come at 8pm to get your Linux environment installed!)
- SLAC Meta discussion: Talk about SLAC and plan future SLAC-athons! (10pm EH2)
- Personal work and team projects! (8-12am EH2)


Join the conversation on Slack<http://olin.slack.com>!

Subject: [Carpediem] free minolta xg1

Film camera body, without a lens. Mirror looks fine and shutter operates alright, but the body-lens interface may be damaged. I don't know about the condition of the rest of the camera. In EH2W.
