From Alexander.Crease at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  8 09:45:05 2014
From: Alexander.Crease at students.olin.edu (Alexander Crease)
Date: Wed, 8 Oct 2014 09:45:05 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Olin Replicator Space now open for training!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4BD0BAF@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey everyone,

I'd like to let everyone know that we are now opening up the Replicators in the library for public use. We are still testing a few things about the space, but we are now open to train people during 3D printer office hours in the Library! Here are all the things you need to know:


*         IF YOU WERE TRAINED BEFORE, PUT YOUR NAME ON THIS SPREADSHEET<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1P3SJnThcFhe-9tCjuTNj-6oGmcd4pFtqmckx8iRVRKA/edit#gid=0>. We are creating a "replicator-users" list to send updates to students trained on the Replicators. Info about the new space and procedures:

o   There has been an update to MakerWare, now called MakerBot Desktop

o   Submit print jobs here: http://tinyurl.com/olinreplicatorform

o   Submit problems here: http://tinyurl.com/olinreplicatorproblems

*         If you would like to be trained or need a refresher, come to 3D printing office hours in the library, listed below.

*         Our 3D printing NINJAs are Alexander Crease, Tatiana Anthony, Frances Devanbu, and Shane Kelly

*         We currently have three Replicator 2s and two Replicator 2Xs, but we will only be training people on the Replicator 2s. We will use a work order system for the 2Xs.

*         We will be prioritizing classes, then research, then student teams, then passionate pursuits, and then personal projects

Office Hours (may be subject to change; the Library will have them posted):
Monday: 4-6, 7-9PM
Tuesday: 7:45-9:45PM
Wednesday: 8-10PM
Thursday: 7-10PM
Sunday: 9-11PM


Thanks!

Alex, Tatiana, Shane, and Frances.
-------------- next part --------------

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal>Hey everyone,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>I&#8217;d like to let everyone know that we are now opening up the Replicators in the library for public use. We are still testing a few things about the space, but we are now open to train people during 3D printer office hours in the Library! Here are all the things you need to know:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>IF YOU WERE TRAINED BEFORE, PUT YOUR NAME ON <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1P3SJnThcFhe-9tCjuTNj-6oGmcd4pFtqmckx8iRVRKA/edit#gid=0">THIS SPREADSHEET</a>. We are creating a &#8220;replicator-users&#8221; list to send updates to students trained on the Replicators<span style='color:#1F497D'>. </span>Info about the new space and procedures:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='margin-left:1.0in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>There has been an update to MakerWare, now called MakerBot Desktop<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='margin-left:1.0in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>Submit print jobs here: <a href="http://tinyurl.com/olinreplicatorform"><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Verdana","sans-serif";color:#1155CC;background:white'>http://tinyurl.com/olinreplicatorform</span></b></a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='margin-left:1.0in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>Submit problems here: <a href="http://tinyurl.com/olinreplicatorproblems"><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Verdana","sans-serif";color:#1155CC;background:white'>http://tinyurl.com/olinreplicatorproblems</span></b></a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>If you would like to be trained or need a refresher, come to 3D printing office hours in the library, listed below.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>Our 3D printing NINJAs are Alexander Crease, Tatiana Anthony, Frances Devanbu, and Shane Kelly<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>We currently have three Replicator 2s and two Replicator 2Xs, but we will only be training people on the Replicator 2s. We will use a work order system for the 2Xs. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>We will be prioritizing classes, then research, then student teams, then passionate pursuits, and then personal projects<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Office Hours (may be subject to change; the Library will have them posted):<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Monday: 4-6, 7-9PM<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Tuesday: 7:45-9:45PM<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Wednesday: 8-10PM<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Thursday: 7-10PM<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Sunday: 9-11PM<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Thanks!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Alex, Tatiana, Shane, and Frances.<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Aaron.Greiner at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  8 18:40:43 2014
From: Aaron.Greiner at students.olin.edu (Aaron Greiner)
Date: Wed, 8 Oct 2014 18:40:43 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Change the way Olin deals with waste!
Message-ID: <5673C8ED-0B4F-421D-94F2-98DA366F3DFC@students.olin.edu>

Hi!

I would like to apply to get funding from the green initiatives fund to change the way Olin deals with waste (trash, recycling, compost). There are a lot of ways that we could improve our system (new bins, clearer sing, more compost, etc) that would make Olin much more sustainable!

If you are interested and would like to help me/if you are already doing this and want to join forces, please contact me!!! I think this is an awesome opportunity to make a difference, and it would be great to get as many people involved as possible!!

Best,
Aaron Greiner

From christopher.lee at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  8 23:07:47 2014
From: christopher.lee at students.olin.edu (Chris Lee)
Date: Wed, 8 Oct 2014 23:07:47 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] COLUMBUS DAY SLAC-ATHON (HACKATHON!)
Message-ID: <CAPz2RoRJPTg+g+rECs1eFfw5iZkQSi-LEoaenrnvv0qaVarweA@mail.gmail.com>

SLAC and Computing Conversations is hosting a hackathon on:
*Columbus Day from 10AM to 4PM in the Dining Hall Mezzanine! *

Microsoft will be sponsoring this hackathon through Jamie Gorson!

There will be a *REALLY BIG, REALLY LEGIT* prize available. The prize will
be given out via a raffle, but WITH A TWIST! The top four winning teams of
the hackathon will be given more raffle tickets to enter. Teams will be up
to 4 people depending on the turnout. Microsoft will also be providing
food/refreshments/etc (to be determine exactly what).

The hackathon is open to ALL Olin students. There will be no specific
prompt, but we may provide suggestions during the hackathon for teams that
need a direction. We will reveal the criteria for the winning team on the
day of the hackathon.

If you have any ideas, suggestions, or questions, let us know!!

- Chris Lee
-------------- next part --------------

From Halie.Murray-Davis at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  8 23:10:48 2014
From: Halie.Murray-Davis at students.olin.edu (Halie Murray-Davis)
Date: Wed, 8 Oct 2014 23:10:48 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Fly Fishing/trip in Western MA!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4BD114E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Western Mass fishing! Back by popular demand!

Last summer 5 of us went out to western, MA and fished, swam, and looked at pretty scenery for a day. I'd like to go again. I'm considering going this Saturday, Sunday, or Monday. If you'd like to go, too, reply to this email, and let me know your name and when you could come. It's an all day trip and is about 2-3 hours drive time each way, depending on where we go. It will probably be a bit cold to swim, but there will be pretty scenery, if you don't want to fish. If you'd like to fish, I have 2 extra rods you can borrow. If you don't know how to fish, I can teach you. I come from a salt water fishing background and don't really know how to catch fresh water fish, so don't expect to catch a lot unless you know what you're doing. Legally, you should have a MA fishing license if you're fishing. We will have fun! I'm paying for gas and driving, so if you want to go, let me know! We'll probably go to the Deerfield, Miller, or Swift rivers. I could potentially be persuaded to cross over the New York boarder, but then I'd probably want to spend the night there.

Halie
-------------- next part --------------

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  9 01:12:49 2014
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Thu, 9 Oct 2014 01:12:49 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Extra Life 2014 - Raise Money, Play Games
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A31FB8D5@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey friends!

Last year, I did Extra Life. It's a day where people from all over the world get together and play games to raise money for children's hospitals. Ya know, being sick sucks. For some kids, being sick means they spend more time in hospitals then they do at home. This means hours laying in bed, playing with shitty toys and watching soap operas on tiny TVs. It also means being frightened about what tomorrow might bring, or even if tomorrow might happen. Let's raise some money for hospitals so they can provide the best care both medically and generally.

You can donate here: http://www.extra-life.org/participant/lego6245. If we hit the goal, I dunno what will happen, but something good.

You can also sign up at http://www.extra-life.org/ and raise money for your local hospital!

If you've got any questions, let me know.

-William Saulnier

Subject: [edisco] SWAT A SHUTTLECOCK

Hey friends,
Do you like shuttlecocks? Do you like Jess Sutantio? Do you like throwing things at people?
[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFE3B1.057FC590]
At the weekly edisco meeting this week from 3:30-3:45 on the DH Mezz, we will be learning about/demonstrating projectile motion and thinking about relevant curriculum. That's right, this meeting is only 15 minutes*. Come throw things at people.

<3
The Four

*If you're doing Sprague stick around until 4:30 :),
and if you're not and you still want to stick around you can do that too.

	color:purple;

p.MsoAcetate, li.MsoAcetate, div.MsoAcetate
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text Char";
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.EmailStyle19
	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.EmailStyle20
	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

From Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  9 12:34:07 2014
From: Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu (Amanda Lee)
Date: Thu, 9 Oct 2014 12:34:07 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] F.I.L.M. Presents Sympathy for Lady Vengeance @ 10:00 PM
Message-ID: <9E41E436-8FFF-4289-9148-40AE42289D3B@students.olin.edu>

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: Rec<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YGJ_jPKOj1c>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:9A47E9E0-8C23-4279-900D-02D44143147F at olin.edu]

This week we're moving away from the full on horror and watching a Korean revenge thriller. It's part of a "trilogy" of movies that also center around revenge by director Park Chan-Wook (who also made Oldboy). Warning: There is a lot of violence and disturbing scenes in this movie. I really enjoy this movie and it's really interesting, but don't say I didn't warn you.

Amanda Lee, F.I.L.M. Director
Mary Ruthven, [Rec] was too scary.
Rachel Mathew, dunno for snacks...
Helen Lyons, 112 minutes
-------------- next part --------------

From: ediscovery [mailto:ediscovery-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor
Sent: Thursday, October 09, 2014 11:06 AM
To: ediscovery at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [edisco] SWAT A SHUTTLECOCK

Hey friends,
Do you like shuttlecocks? Do you like Jess Sutantio? Do you like throwing things at people?
[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFE3C9.6B4688B0]
At the weekly edisco meeting this week from 3:30-3:45 on the DH Mezz, we will be learning about/demonstrating projectile motion and thinking about relevant curriculum. That's right, this meeting is only 15 minutes*. Come throw things at people.

<3
The Four

*If you're doing Sprague stick around until 4:30 :),
and if you're not and you still want to stick around you can do that too.

From dredfern.olin at gmail.com  Thu Oct  9 14:20:59 2014
From: dredfern.olin at gmail.com (Derek Redfern)
Date: Thu, 9 Oct 2014 14:20:59 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Book Return Kiosk - Request for design/build help from
	an Olin group
Message-ID: <CA+O+WhHaShFAuqu6QsCV3MU4C+UbnXbKsaN6esB_JN8xTRPdiw@mail.gmail.com>

This is a request from someone I'm working with for IPD. He's looking for
someone to do some volunteer design work followed by compensation if the
project is eventually funded, and possible implementation work as well.
Contact him directly at his cell (below) or tim at retirementjobs.com if
interested!

-----------------------------

I serve as a Director on the Wellesley Free Library Foundation.  There is a
project
we are giving some early thought to.  It is a sponsorship opportunity that
involves firms like Whole Foods "hosting" a book return kiosk.  The kiosk
would offer Whole Foods customers the convenience of returning books when
they do their grocery shopping and provide a visible connection to the
Library.  We are also thinking of designing the kiosk so that it would be
'green friendly' by being internet-connected, to enable renewing and
reserving books.

Because our Foundation's charter is to raise funds for much-needed
programming and technology at the Library, we would be asking sponsors for
a financial contribution in addition to making the space available
somewhere at their store.

I am writing to ask if an Olin student or student group would help in the
design/execution of this kiosk.  If there is sponsor support (which I
expect there will be), we would be in a position to fund the design.  For
the time being, it is only in concept stage so funds are not yet
available.  Please let me know if there might be be interest.

Regards,
Tim
781-801-4487 (cell)
-------------- next part --------------

From Gordon.Haag at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  9 18:51:58 2014
From: Gordon.Haag at students.olin.edu (Gordon Haag)
Date: Thu, 9 Oct 2014 18:51:58 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Watch the ISS fly over tonight!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4BD1573@EXVS01.olin.edu>

At 6:58pm (short notice I know) the ISS will appear on the horizon. Look to the southwest. It will be visible for 6 minutes, disappearing in the east-northeast direction.

Currently, there are 3 people aboard. The station travels at 15,000mph and  does an entire orbit in 90 minutes.

Gordon Haag

	panose-1:2 1 6 0 3 1 1 1 1 1;}

p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}

	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}

	{size:8.5in 11.0in;

From Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  9 20:16:00 2014
From: Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu (Toni Saylor)
Date: Thu, 9 Oct 2014 20:16:00 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Friday Agenda!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4BD15EC@EXVS01.olin.edu>

[cid:image002.jpg at 01CFE3FD.D8199520]
Caf? Diem will be open at 10 serving various baked goods.
The North End will be open 9-11 serving homemade Che Chuoi (banana and coconut milk soup) and Nem Nuong (viatnemese grilled pork skewers)and doing a Fortune Cookie Puzzle sponsored by the Puzzles co-curricular.
The Aire Ni Lounge (properly accented above) will be open at 8:00 with Cards Against Humanity's 4th and 5th expansions and tea.
The Pass No Record will be open 9-12 doing 'that thing that they do.'
The Rock Cavern will be open 9-12 with Guitar Hero and Rock Band.
Midnight Waffles will open at 9:00 with... 9:00 waffles.
Stop Pop and Roll will be serving popcorn at 6:15, and showing Korra at 6:30.
Kreek Life will be open selling Ramen at a time.
Vanilla Dice will be playing Candyland from 9-11:30. After our early closure:
Spicy Dice will be holding its only public event of the year! Some of you might recall our game of shirtless* battle twister from the end of the six week period  last year. Come celebrate the end of this year's six weeks with us from 12-2 in WH 430.  Cat-shaped sugar cookies and sausage will be served.

*shirtless-ness encouraged by not remotely enforced

	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}

	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}

	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}

	{page:WordSection1;}

From christopher.lee at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  9 20:49:05 2014
From: christopher.lee at students.olin.edu (Chris Lee)
Date: Thu, 9 Oct 2014 20:49:05 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] [SLACATHON] PRIZE REVEALED: Sign up quick!
Message-ID: <CAPz2RoQeTfMdKA_HpT2PGkume-=aaz5c-3-apb=Pzj4zfuaBtQ@mail.gmail.com>

THE RAFFLE PRIZE IS:
http://shop.lenovo.com/us/en/laptops/lenovo/yoga-laptop-series/yoga-laptop-2-13/
(the i5 one)

The prize will be raffled off. Every one who presents their project that
they worked on during the Slacathon will be able to enter 1 raffle ticket.
Winners will be receive more raffle tickets - enough to make it worth
winning.

We will announce the criteria for judging the day of the slacathon and the
audience will vote at the end of presentations the points awarded to each
team via a google form.

Quick! Sign up and get teams and ideate here:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LdlHe-BPii8nlAh_1PRe-h0qn6uSmphbFgFxq-mVRkQ/edit#gid=0

Updates will posted on the same link. Let me know if you have any questions.

Chris
On Wed, Oct 8, 2014 at 11:07 PM, Chris Lee <
christopher.lee at students.olin.edu> wrote:

> SLAC and Computing Conversations is hosting a hackathon on:
> *Columbus Day from 10AM to 4PM in the Dining Hall Mezzanine! *
>
> Microsoft will be sponsoring this hackathon through Jamie Gorson!
>
> There will be a *REALLY BIG, REALLY LEGIT* prize available. The prize
> will be given out via a raffle, but WITH A TWIST! The top four winning
> teams of the hackathon will be given more raffle tickets to enter. Teams
> will be up to 4 people depending on the turnout. Microsoft will also be
> providing food/refreshments/etc (to be determine exactly what).
>
> The hackathon is open to ALL Olin students. There will be no specific
> prompt, but we may provide suggestions during the hackathon for teams that
> need a direction. We will reveal the criteria for the winning team on the
> day of the hackathon.
>
> If you have any ideas, suggestions, or questions, let us know!!
>
> - Chris Lee
>

From benjamin.kroop at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  9 20:51:55 2014
From: benjamin.kroop at students.olin.edu (Ben Kroop)
Date: Thu, 9 Oct 2014 20:51:55 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] MIT Flying Club Flyout this Saturday
Message-ID: <CAJiEShhQWmdvXpV+OxOO9jkysz1P-8q3S_Tee0BkXS_foBO0Lw@mail.gmail.com>

The MIT Flying Club will fly out to the Old Rhinebeck Aerodrome in Red
Hook, NY on *Saturday, October 11th*. Old Rhinebeck is an aviation and
automobile museum located in upstate New York. The Aerodrome features
aeroplanes, automobiles, motorcycles, early engines and memorabilia from
1900-1939.

Every weekend during the summer the museum puts on an air show. This
weekend is the last air show of the season.

More information about Old Rhinebeck: http://www.oldrhinebeck.org/

If you want to fly to New York in a small plane, or if you want to see an
air show and visit an interesting museum, there's a link to sign up for the
event at the bottom of the email. Because everyone on the trip will be
sharing the cost of the planes, the cost for each passenger will be around
$180 (more details below). Once assigned, your pilot can give you a more
accurate estimate of flight cost.

*Cost logistics:*

Each passenger and pilot will pay their share of the cost of renting the
aircraft. The planes are rented by the hour, and the flight time will be
between 3 and 4 hours. This brings the total cost per passenger to between
$135 and $200, depending on the plane, number of passengers, and the
weather.

*If you would like to come as a passenger, please fill out this survey:*

Survey: http://goo.gl/GRTWKH

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks!
Ben
?
-------------- next part --------------

You'll be glad you did.

Subject: [Carpediem] Come hang out in the Sukkah!

Do you like hanging out outside?

Are you a fan of SHANE!!!!!!

What about building sukkahs out of yummy snacks and getting points from SHANE for it?

If so you should probably come out between the dorms and hang out with us in the sukkah. Its lots of fun I promise. Also did I mention there are snacks?  Come get cultured.

Any of those would be cool. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Lemme know. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Meg<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><img width=360 height=235 id="Picture_x0020_2" src="cid:image002.jpg at 01CFE412.CF13A870" alt="delete soon.jpg"><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Cambria","serif"'>Meg Lidrbauch </span></b><span style='font-family:"Cambria","serif"'>| Class of 2017<b><o:p></o:p></b></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Cambria","serif"'>Mechanical Engineering Student<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Cambria","serif"'>(978) 810-0796</span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Cambria","serif"'>|</span></b><span style='font-family:"Cambria","serif"'><a href="mlidrbauch.me">mlidrbauch.me</a><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Cambria","serif"'><img border=0 width=205 height=39 id="Picture_x0020_1" src="cid:image003.png at 01CFE412.CF13A870" alt="Olin Logo"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct 10 02:19:28 2014
From: Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu (Kai Austin)
Date: Fri, 10 Oct 2014 02:19:28 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Seeking content editor for book
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4BD1854@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Tr;dl Seeking content editor to help polish short stories for self-publishing.

Long:
As some of you may know, I am currently trying to publish 2 books, one of which is an anthology of short stories I hope to self-publish before the end of the semester. My current editor, as awesome as she is, is a mother with 3 children and a full time job + recent promotion. So it is a little on the slow end. I  am seeking an additional editor to help pick up the slack for the final 4 major short stories, few poems, and flash fiction (30-40k words).

Qualifications,

1)      Experience editing other people's work (editing creative works is preferred)

2)      Enthusiasm for creative literature, especially the magical-realism, psychological thrillers, and horror genre

3)      Not afraid to rip things apart, but maintains respect for the story (i.e. How can this story be better?)

For consistency sake, I will NOT take more than one person for this phase. If you do not think you can fully commit, I will not consider you. You will be doing content editing:
https://suite.io/kimberly-dawn-wells/54v278,
http://www.crayne.com/articles/Copy-Editing-Versus-Content-Editing.pdf
(It is NOT 'feedback')
Line & Copy editing is saved for later unless there is something repulsively outstanding you notice - I will likely seek editors for these later. If you want an example of what I am looking for/how my current editor does things, feel free to ask.

Compensation terms:
You will be paid based on the length of each story you edit (working out official, but it will be something like 1-cent per 10 words). I am happy to negotiate because I know that is low for professional freelance standard, but I don't have that much...

The Book:
http://dotkai.com/books/Evanescence.htm

A note on what I write:
A lot of my stories often imply things such as (trigger warning) death, murder, bullying, child abuse, suicide attempts, slavery/sex slavery, rape, etc. The stuff you read may/may-not involve them. I also recommend having an open mind because they double as a philosophical thought experiment. On steroids.
-------------- next part --------------

	margin-left:2.25in;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	font-family:"Courier New";}
@list l1:level6
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:\F0A7;
	mso-level-tab-stop:none;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	margin-left:2.75in;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	font-family:Wingdings;}
@list l1:level7
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:\F0B7;
	mso-level-tab-stop:none;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	margin-left:3.25in;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	font-family:Symbol;}
@list l1:level8
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:o;
	mso-level-tab-stop:none;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	margin-left:3.75in;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	font-family:"Courier New";}
@list l1:level9
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:\F0A7;
	mso-level-tab-stop:none;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	margin-left:4.25in;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	font-family:Wingdings;}
ol
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
ul
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
<o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1026" />
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
<o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
<o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1" />
</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal>Tr;dl Seeking content editor to help polish short stories for self-publishing.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Long:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>As some of you may know, I am currently trying to publish 2 books, one of which is an anthology of short stories I hope to self-publish before the end of the semester. My current editor, as awesome as she is, is a mother with 3 children and a full time job + recent promotion. So it is a little on the slow end. I&nbsp; am seeking an additional editor to help pick up the slack for the final 4 major short stories, few poems, and flash fiction (30-40k words).<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Qualifications,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>1)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>Experience editing other people&#8217;s work (editing creative works is preferred)<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>2)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>Enthusiasm for creative literature, especially the magical-realism, psychological thrillers, and horror genre<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>3)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>Not afraid to rip things apart, but maintains respect for the story (i.e. How can this story be better?)<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>For consistency sake, I will NOT take more than one person for this phase. If you do not think you can fully commit, I will not consider you. You will be doing content editing: <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="https://suite.io/kimberly-dawn-wells/54v278">https://suite.io/kimberly-dawn-wells/54v278</a>, <br><a href="http://www.crayne.com/articles/Copy-Editing-Versus-Content-Editing.pdf">http://www.crayne.com/articles/Copy-Editing-Versus-Content-Editing.pdf</a> <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>(It is NOT &#8216;feedback&#8217;)<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Line &amp; Copy editing is saved for later unless there is something repulsively outstanding you notice &#8211; I will likely seek editors for these later. If you want an example of what I am looking for/how my current editor does things, feel free to ask.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Compensation terms:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>You will be paid based on the length of each story you edit (working out official, but it will be something like 1-cent per 10 words). I am happy to negotiate because I know that is low for professional freelance standard, but I don&#8217;t have that much...<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>The Book:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><a href="http://dotkai.com/books/Evanescence.htm">http://dotkai.com/books/Evanescence.htm</a><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>A note on what I write:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>A lot of my stories often imply things such as (trigger warning) death, murder, bullying, child abuse, suicide attempts, slavery/sex slavery, rape, etc. The stuff you read may/may-not involve them. I also recommend having an open mind because they double as a philosophical thought experiment. On steroids.<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

Here is an AWESOME opportunity to find work out in Seattle with Tableau. If you like big data this is a great gig!
James Nee

From: Steven Zhang [mailto:steven at stevenzhang.net]
Sent: Friday, October 10, 2014 11:57 AM
To: James Nee
Subject: Come analyze some Olin admissions data (and eat pizza)- Tableau info session, today 12:30pm Crescent room


Hey all,

Looking for a software job in Seattle? Check out Tableau Software<http://www.tableausoftware.com>, consistently rated one of the best places to work in Seattle<http://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/special/2014/WaBestWorkplaces>.

We'll be having an info session today at 12:30pm. Pizza will be provided, and we'll have some swag to give out.

We'll be demo'ing the product with some Olin data, as well as talking about our experiences working at Tableau.

Also, as part of the demo, we want to use Tableau to analyze your data! So if there's a dataset you'd like to analyze (and wouldn't mind having everyone see), please bring a USB drive with a csv/excel of your data. Make sure the first row is a header, and each successive row well formed, has matching number of columns, and contains minimal null values.

Any questions, let me know

--

-Steven '12

LinkedIn: stevenqzhang<http://goo.gl/lKYbxG>
stevenzhang.com<http://stevenzhang.com/>



--

-Steven

stevenzhang.com<http://stevenzhang.com/>



--

-Steven

LinkedIn: stevenqzhang<http://goo.gl/lKYbxG>
stevenzhang.com<http://stevenzhang.com/>

Make sure the first row is a header, and each successive row well formed, has matching number of columns, and contains minimal null values.<o:p></o:p></p></div><div><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div><div><p class=MsoNormal>Any questions, let me know<span style='color:#888888'><br clear=all><span class=hoenzb><o:p></o:p></span></span></p><div><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div><p class=MsoNormal><span class=hoenzb><span style='color:#888888'>-- </span><o:p></o:p></span></p><div><div><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#888888'><br>-Steven '12</span><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p><div><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#888888'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p></div><div><div><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#888888'><a href="http://goo.gl/lKYbxG" target="_blank"><span style='color:#1155CC'>LinkedIn: stevenqzhang</span></a><o:p></o:p></span></p></div><div><p class=MsoNormal><span Frequently asked questions about tomorrow's party in EH2N:

I'm a first year. Should I come?
YES.

Can I just wear what I'd normally wear to parties?

YES.

Can I dress up like a cat?
YES.

Can I dress up like this?
YES.

Does this mean no Sausage Fest this year?
YES.

Is this going to be PUSSY riot, or pussy RIOT?
YES.

Okay, but like, is it going to be cat-themed, or feminist Russian music themed, or...
YES.

Are you seriously just answering every question with
YES.

To be honest, some of these don't even seem like frequently asked questions. Like this one, for instance. I have, like, literally zero confidence in your unbiased frequency sampling.
YES.

Fuck it. I'm excited.
YES.

Your name is Sausage Riot. Does that mean...
No. It means literally nothing.

It means that gmail didn't allow any emails or usernames containing any form of the word "pussy", hotmail didn't allow it in your username, and Yahoo, the most sane of the three, still doesn't allow the word in your given name.

Pussies.

 some of these don't even seem like frequently asked questions. Like this one, for instance. I have, like, literally zero confidence in your unbiased frequency sampling.</span></div><div style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 16px; font-family: HelveticaNeue, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif; font-style: normal; background-color: transparent;"><span>YES.</span></div><div style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 16px; font-family: HelveticaNeue, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif; font-style: normal; background-color: transparent;"><span style="font-weight:bold;"><br></span></div><div style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 16px; font-family: HelveticaNeue, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif; font-style: normal; background-color: transparent;"><span style="font-weight:bold;">Fuck it. From Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct 10 21:04:18 2014
From: Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu (Toni Saylor)
Date: Fri, 10 Oct 2014 21:04:18 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Friday Agenda!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4BD15EC@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4BD15EC@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4F9088E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

The North End is open now until 11! Come get it while it's hot.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor
Sent: Thursday, October 09, 2014 8:16 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] 4N Friday Agenda!

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFE4CD.C1ADDFA0]
Caf? Diem will be open at 10 serving various baked goods.
The North End will be open 9-11 serving homemade Che Chuoi (banana and coconut milk soup) and Nem Nuong (viatnemese grilled pork skewers)and doing a Fortune Cookie Puzzle sponsored by the Puzzles co-curricular.
The Aire Ni Lounge (properly accented above) will be open at 8:00 with Cards Against Humanity's 4th and 5th expansions and tea.
The Pass No Record will be open 9-12 doing 'that thing that they do.'
The Rock Cavern will be open 9-12 with Guitar Hero and Rock Band.
Midnight Waffles will open at 9:00 with... 9:00 waffles.
Stop Pop and Roll will be serving popcorn at 6:15, and showing Korra at 6:30.
Kreek Life will be open selling Ramen at a time.
Vanilla Dice will be playing Candyland from 9-11:30. After our early closure:
Spicy Dice will be holding its only public event of the year! Some of you might recall our game of shirtless* battle twister from the end of the six week period  last year. Come celebrate the end of this year's six weeks with us from 12-2 in WH 430.  Cat-shaped sugar cookies and sausage will be served.

*shirtless-ness encouraged by not remotely enforced

	panose-1:2 11 6 4 3 5 4 4 2 4;}
/* Style Definitions */
p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
p.MsoAcetate, li.MsoAcetate, div.MsoAcetate
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text Char";
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}

	{page:WordSection1;}

Subject: [Carpediem] OMUN Mailing List is Out!!!!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4F909EE@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Carpe,

No more shotgunning things about Model UN on carpe! Follow the link below and join the mailing list for developing the program, learning about the world and making a difference out of the Olin Bubble. Amazing fun. Amazing usage. Do not miss out and join! Also, if you have any interest in GSCP or have no idea what that is, join as well, this is about to be really big!

Link: https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/omun

CLICK ON IT!

Regards,
Manik Singh Sethi

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Deborah Hellen

Subject: Re: [Carpediem] (Reminder!)Pour One Out For The Homies...Open Night

Reminder: This is happening tonight at 10!

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Deborah Hellen
Sent: Saturday, October 11, 2014 10:27 PM
To: Students - Class of 2016; carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [Carpediem] Pour One Out For The Homies...Open Night

This semester, the Class of 2016 has taken a beating. So this Second Saturday* starting at 10 PM those of us in 3W want to celebrate our Fallen Comrades that we love and miss by throwing down Dancing Horse style.

*We mean Sunday night. We don't have class Monday. Therefore Sunday = Second Saturday.

Pour one out for the homies!
[cid:image003.jpg at 01CFE669.7043F490]

From Julianne.Jorgensen at students.olin.edu  Sun Oct 12 22:25:46 2014
From: Julianne.Jorgensen at students.olin.edu (Julianne Jorgensen)
Date: Sun, 12 Oct 2014 22:25:46 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] GCSP Brainstorming, Crecent Room, Friday 10/17 1-4pm
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A4F90EAC@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Tl;dr: Ideation session about Challenges in Engineering in the Crescent Room on Friday 10/17 from 1-4pm (hour sessions). iCal attached

Hi Carpe,
The second Global Grand Challenges Summit on the US National Academy of Engineering (NAE) Grand Challenges for Engineering (GCs) will be held in Beijing, September 13-16, 2015. The first Summit was held in London in March 2013, please see link: http://www.raeng.org.uk/policy/international-policy-and-development/international-policy/current-issues/global-grand-challenges-summit-2013. More information about the conference is attached.

To kick-off, we will be hosting an ideation session in the Crescent room this Friday 10/17 from 1-4 pm (iCal attached), people can come and go with their availability and interest. We will be specifying problem spaces encompassed in the Grand Challenges and ideating potential solutions that can be built. We will focus on the areas of Sustainability, Security, Health, and Joy of Living.

Families are invited and might be excited to see Olin design in action.

Hope to see you there!
Julianne

If you want to know more about the grand challenges: http://www.engineeringchallenges.org/cms/challenges.aspx
-------------- next part --------------

The first Summit was held in London in March 2013, please see link: <a href="http://www.raeng.org.uk/policy/international-policy-and-development/international-policy/current-issues/global-grand-challenges-summit-2013">http://www.raeng.org.uk/policy/international-policy-and-development/international-policy/current-issues/global-grand-challenges-summit-2013</a>. More information about the conference is attached.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt;color:black'>&nbsp;</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>To kick-off, we will be hosting an ideation session in the <b>Crescent room this Friday 10/17 from 1-4 pm</b> (iCal attached), people can come and go with their availability and interest. We will be <b>specifying problem spaces</b> encompassed in the Grand Challenges and <b>ideating potential solutions</b> that can be built. We will focus on the areas of<i> </i></span><em><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";font-style:normal'>Sustainability, Security, Health, and Joy of Living</span></em><i><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>.</span></i><i><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></i></p><p class=MsoNormal><i><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt;color:#C00000'>Families are invited </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>and might be excited to see Olin design in action.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>Hope to see you there!<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>Julianne <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>If you want to know more about the grand challenges: <a href="http://www.engineeringchallenges.org/cms/challenges.aspx">http://www.engineeringchallenges.org/cms/challenges.aspx</a> <o:p></o:p></span></p></div></body></html>
